meanings.definition: To calculate the total of something.
meanings.sent1: I totalized the number of apples in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She totalized the cost of all the items in her shopping cart.
meanings.sent3: The robot totalized the number of steps it took to reach the end of the maze.
meanings.sent4: The accountant totalized the expenses with lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to totalize the scores for the quiz.

meanings.definition: To bring together all parts to form a whole.
meanings.sent1: He totalized all the ingredients to make the perfect cake.
meanings.sent2: The team totalized their efforts to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The magician totalized the separate pieces into a single, whole rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The conductor totalized the individual notes into a harmonious symphony.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle enthusiast totalized the scattered pieces into a beautiful picture.

meanings.sent1: Let me totalize the main points of the story for you.
meanings.sent2: The speaker totalized his speech with a powerful conclusion.
meanings.sent3: The comedian totalized the evening with a hilarious joke.
meanings.sent4: The artist totalized the emotions of the painting in a single brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The coach totalized the game plan in a concise strategy.
